column4: hi could someone more awesome than me please tell me how to search my apache2 folder for references to port 80???
grep 80 * inside /etc/apache2
thx ur awesome
you could even do grep -r 80 /etc/apache2/*
none of them are conflicting
so you're saying i must have two references to port 80 in ONE file to get the message that my por t80 is already being used then??
2 references? in which file?
netstat -punta | grep 80
make that "sudo netstat -punta | grep 80"
okay i see something using it now
what process is it?
im not so sure how to read what im seeing here... i see a buncha IPs... i see "tcp" and "time_wait" as well as "listen"
pastebin the output
- my paste bin for sudo netstat -punta | grep 80 http://www.mibbit.com/pb/hBMSq8
so your apache is listening on port 80, which is fine
why wont my apache restart? do i need to force it to stop or something?
pastebin the output of sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart
thanks btw, here is the apache restart: http://www.mibbit.com/pb/ZUxVt4
do a "sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 stop" and after that "ps -ef | grep apache" pastebin the output of the latter
apache stopped, then "ps -ef | grep apache" http://www.mibbit.com/pb/THGA28
try "sudo kill -9 5446 5457 5464" followed by "sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 start"
no such process, is that okay?
see if "ps -ef | grep apache" generates some output now, if there's only a line with grep it's ok
i guess it was okay because it just started :) thank you so much
